data.title: Intellectual Property Office in Finland
data.meta_description: You can find all the information of Finland about trademarks, patents, utility models, copyrights, registered designs, and all other IP …
data.text:
Business Support

Basic services of the Finnish Patent and Registration Office are available at the Centres for Economic Development, Transport and the Environment all over Finland. The Centres for Economic Development, Transport and the Environment offer patent-related information material, forms, price lists and brochures and give general advice. The Centres also comprise the PATLIB centre network in Finland.

Innovation agents

The Finnish Patent and Registration Office cooperates together with the Centres for Economic Development, Transport and the Environment and their 16 innovation experts who work at the Centres for Economic Development, Transport and the Environment. Their task is to promote innovation and the technical, productional and commercial exploitation of inventions. They counsel inventors in questions relating to patenting and other industrial property issues, applying for funding and the development of one’s product.

Services at universities and higher education institutions

The Finnish Patent and Registration Office cooperates with innovation service units of several universities and institutions of higher education who work at the institutions in question. Their task is to promote innovation and the technical, productional and commercial exploitation of inventions, but with the main focus on promoting innovative ideas that arise from the academic world. They also counsel inventors in questions relating to patenting and other industrial property issues, applying for funding and the development of one’s product.

Publications and Subscription

Trademarks in business – guide

This guide is designed for those SMEs which hasn’t use trademarks before. Guide is available in Finnish, in three formats (book, pdf and html). Published 2006.

The Workbook Immaterial Property Issues In Business

Guide is available in English as PDF. Published 2006. Read more.

The main goal is to encourage the enterprises to utilise Immaterial Property in their businesses, focusing at IP from two viewpoints:

How to utilise sources of information and manage IP knowledge?

How to find appropriate ways of protection for know-how and intellectual property?

The aim is to show and explain:

what the IP means in practice,

how a company can utilise the IP system as a whole, and especially

how to enhance competitiveness through IP system.

The workbook is also to be utilised during the company level strategy development process.

Target groups:

Company management and key personnel – primary target group

IP service sector (patent attorneys, lawyers, patent engineers, etc.)

Professional business services providers (both private and public services)

Research institutes

Universities, colleges and schools

Boost Your Product Development – Guide to search and utilize patent information

Guide is available in Finnish, in three formats (book, pdf and html). Published 2006

Intention of this guide is to increase the use of patent information in SME:s and to show how to use patent information in product development processes. This guide is useful for people working in product development in SME:s as well as decision-makers in research and marketing.
